chinese: n规范，标准；准则；模范
学生应遵守学校的行为规范。
english: The students should follow the norms of conduct for the school

chinese: n.部落
原始部落的人用木柴生火。
english: The primal tribe people make the fire with wood

chinese: 压迫
他们受够了国王的压迫。
english: They are fed up with the king's oppression

chinese: 1. 教区
牧师和修女们都在教区生活和工作。
english: Priests and nuns both live and work in a parish

chinese: 1，旗帜，横幅
他们举着横幅，呼吁人们“爱护动物”。
english: They held up a banner and called on people to love animals

chinese: 加歹徒，逃犯，丧失公权者V将放逐
这两个人是蛮荒西部的不法之徒。
english: The two men were outlaws in the wild west

chinese: ad）.狂热的，极感兴趣的
他们热爱读书。
四阻碍，妨碍，牵制 回（有盖的）大
这个大球阻碍了男人的闯关之路。
english: This huge ball hampered the man's progress on the obstacle course

chinese: 耐心
钓鱼需要极大的耐心。
english: Fishing demands a great deal of patience

chinese: 以伸展，延伸，张开 几伸展，张开
猫咪在舒展它的身体。
english: The cat is stretching its body

chinese: Y.渴望，向往
他渴望有一座自己的房子。
english: He yearns to have his own house

chinese: 1. 全景，概观
这张全景显示了整个城市的天际线。
english: This panorama shows the entire downtown skyline

chinese: n.责备，过失 VI 责备，把…••归咎于
我总是受到所有的责备，但我从没做错过任何事。
english: I always get all the blame, but I never do anything wrong

chinese: ad，最佳的，最理想的
筷子是吃面的最佳选择。
english: Chopsticks would be the optimal choice to serve noodles

chinese: 2.采矿；矿业
露天采矿破坏了这里的土地。
english: Strip mining has destroyed the land here

chinese: adj，有名望的，有威信的
牛津大学是世界上最有声望的大学之一。
english: Oxford University is one of the most prestigious universities in the world
